newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends mostly lower on funds, locals.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends mostly lower on funds, locals.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended mostly lower on fund and local selling, traders said.

"The funds sold about 350 March, locals sold and Cargill, XCan bought March and January," a trader said. Commission houses traded May, July options. May-July spread at $0.50, Jan-Mar $2, Mar-May $2, Nov-May $9.10, Nov-Jan $6. November futures crush margin rose to -27.60 from -30.09 Friday.
"If the crush margin can improve another five or 10 dollars we'll see crushers take more seed," a trader said.
November canola rose $0.20 to $383.50, January lost $2 to $388.10. July and August set new lows. Peas didn't trade.
January flax rose $3 to $358.60 on commercial buying as funds sold earlier in the session, traders said.
Cargill sold 25 December oats up US$1.50 at US$119.50, traders said.
November western barley rose $0.50 to $136, February rose $1.10 to $140.30 with Midland Walwyn buying the spread at $3. Nov-Feb ended at $4, Feb-Mar $0.90, Nov-Mar $4.
December feed wheat rose $1.80 to $164 on commercial and comission short covering.
(All values in Canadian dollars except peas, oats).
